text: WE are in the living quarters of PIERRE DELACROIX.  The windows overlook the Brooklyn Promenade and the majestic lower Manhattan skyline.
Bonjour, my name is Pierre Delacroix. I'm a television writer, also a showrunner, a creative person.
We see a tall figure move in and around the space.
I'm one of those people responsible for what you view on your idiot box.
Monogrammed cuff sleeve - the initials P.D.
The problem is not enough of you have been watching.
Monogrammed shirt pocket - the initials P.D.
With the onslaught of the internet, video and interactive games, nine hundred channels to choose from and whatnot, our valued audience has dramatically eroded.
Razor cuts a path through a white foam on a black face.
To put it in much more simple terms...
Delacroix YELLS.
Like rats fleeing a sinking ship.
The handsome face of Pierre Delacroix.
People tuning out by the millions.
Delacroix turns to the CAMERA and addresses US.
Which is not good.
The tenement building is boarded up, condemned, bombed ou but a home, a shelter nonetheless.

People to our surprise live in here.  It is a commune.  T homeless, people who have been left out, forgot about, written off, and don't matter.  The fringes of society. CHEEBA, a skinny Puerto Rican male, tries to wake a slumbering body under a mass of old newspapers.
Yo, let's get to it.  You don't dance, we don't eat.  Simple as that.
The mass begins to move.
That's right.  We slow.  We blow. We snooze.  We lose.

MANRAY, a young African-American dread-lock male, and Che are getting set up in front of the entrance to the CONTINENTAL NETWORK SYSTEM building.  CNS is one of the fledgling, upstart new networks, trying to battle with AB NBC, CBS, FOX, WB, and UPN.

Entrance.  Cheeba is putting the portable floor down on t sidewalk.  Manray sits on the curb, taking the sneakers o and putting on his tap shoes; bottle caps are on the sole of the shoes instead of real taps.

Good morning, ladies and gentlemen. I know everybody is in a hurry to work, ready to begin another day in this rat race.  But don't sleep us. I'm Cheeba and I introduce to you the world renown MANRAY, the man with the educated feet.
Manray takes a small bow.  A few, not many, people have stopped to look.
As we continue our world wind tour, we would like to give you a little somethin', somethin' before you go off to make that money.  I give you Manray.
Manray, who starts to do his thing, and when he starts do his thing attention must be paid.
Crowd, as Manray gets busy, people gather to watch.
Delacroix, he is about to walk into the CNS building but stops to check out Manray.
Manray, he pounds out some intricate steps and freezes at the end of the move.
Crowd, who applaud as Cheeba unfolds a brown shopping bag and holds it out in front of them.
Thank you very much but please don't go without giving us some cheddar, cheese, money.  We prefer two's than fews.
People are digging into their pockets.
I would like to add that both of us are homeless.  Not that it means anything.
A WOMAN is about to dump some change in the brown paper b
I said homeless.  Ladies and gentlemen.  Senorita, do you know what that means?
Cheeba looks at her and she quickly pulls out a 5-spot fr her purse and drops it into the bag.
Muchos gracias.
Cheeba works his way over to Delacroix.
Good morning, Cheeba.
Good morning to you, Mr. Delapot.
De-la-croix.
Y'know what I mean.  Got a gig yet for Manray and I yet?
Not yet.
Delacroix hands Cheeba a ten dollar bill.
Gracias.
Delacroix moves towards the revolving doors of CNS.
Manray, Sloan says you're too talented to be dancing on the street.
Well do something about it.
Delacroix is the lone person of color in the elevator.
Delacroix gets off the elevator, takes out his ID, slips through the scanner and enters the reception area of CNS.
Good morning, Marie.
It's not gonna be a good morning for you if you don't get into Dunwitty's staff meeting.
What staff meeting?
The staff meeting that started 30 minutes ago.

Delacroix walks, or better yet, slithers into the staff meeting that is already in progress.  TWENTY WRITERS sit around an oval table, all are Caucasian except Delacroix, again he's the lone person of color, the "fly in the buttermilk." DUNWITTY, Senior V.P. of the Entertainment Division of CN looks at Delacroix and waits for him to sit down before h continues.
Monsieur Delacroix, this very important meeting commenced...
Dunwitty looks at his Rolex Chronograph - Daytona Model.
...exactly thirty-two minutes ago.
I'm sorry I'm late.
Do you know how much information can be dispensed in one minute alone?
I didn't find out about this very important staff meeting until...
Delacroix looks at his Jaeger-LeCoultre.
Four minutes ago.
So are you telling me everyone knew about this get-together except you?
I wasn't told about this until Marie informed me as soon as I got off the elevator.
All eyes are on Delacroix and he feels it.
People, you can attempt to pull a Rodman like our friend Delacroix, but I guarantee you'll be sent packing just like him.
Dunwitty via remote turns off the lights and turns on an overhead projector.
These are the standings.  Read 'em and weep.  As you can plainly see the Continental Network System is languishing.
Ratings charts.
Look at 'em people.  We are BOOTY, CA CA.  We are DOO-DOO.  Doo-doo on a stick, if you will.
Dunwitty.
I do not like to be the laughing stock of the broadcast industry.  I have pride and people, you better start getting some too.  These numbers have to go up.
Dunwitty turns on the lights.  JOAN, one of the writers, raises her hand.
Question?
So what do you want us to do?
What I want everyone to do is write some material that is FUNNY.  The junk you've been writing is about as funny as a dead baby.  It's not funny, it's not new.  It's not sexy. It, it, it...
Fish.
Sucks.
Conference room.
SUCKS.  Thank you, Fish.  This meeting is over but I want everyone to seriously think about what I said and how you can deliver.
People scurry out.
Monsieur Delacroix, in my office now.

The writers, beat down, come out of the conference room a move past SLOAN HOPKINS, a highly attractive African- American "sistuh." Delacroix sees Sloan and holds her arm as they walk.  He talks under his breath.
How was it?
Why didn't you tell me about this staff meeting?
Nobody told me anything.
What good are you if you don't tell me stuff like this?
It wasn't my fault.  If I would have known, I would have known.
Delacroix enters his corner office, which has huge action photos of ALI, JORDAN, GRIFFEY, TYSON, AARON and JABBAR o his walls, it is also decorated with African art througho
Office.  Dunwitty looks at the floor-to-ceiling windows overlooking mid-town Manhattan.
Do you know what C.P. Time is?
C.P. Time is Colored People's Time. The stereotypical belief that Negroes are always late.  That Negroes have no sense of time - time except when it comes to music or dance.
They both laugh.
Let's sit down over there.
Dunwitty and Delacroix sit on the sofa.
I'm sorry about my blowup but I have to have a whipping boy every meeting.
I understand.  But again, in all honesty I was not informed.
Forget it.  I believe you're my most creative person I've got on staff.  You're hip.  You know what's happening.  I got some corny white boys and girls writing for me.
Delacroix doesn't join him in his laughter because he doesn't know how to take that comment or where Dunwitty i headed with it.

I understand Black culture.  I grew up around black people all my life. If the truth be told I probably know "niggers" better than you, Monsieur Delacroix.  Please don't get offended by my use of the quote-unquote N word.  I got a black wife and three bi-racial children, so I feel I have a right to use that word.  I don't give a damn what Spike says, Tarantino is right.  Nigger is just a word.  If Dirty Ole Bastard can use it every other word so can I.
I would prefer you not use that word in my presence.
NIGGER.  NIGGER.  NIGGER.  NIGGER.
Delacroix pounces on top of Dunwitty like a cat on a mous and gives him a quick BROOKLYN BEAT DOWN.
Say it again.  C'mon, say it again.
Dunwitty.  He's a bloody pulp.
Delacroix. He straightens his tie.
Who's a nigger now?
POW.  This is a fantasy in Delacroix's mind.  We go BACK REALITY.  Everything's how we left it.
The material you've been creating is too white bread.  White people with black faces.  The Huxtable's, Cosby, revolutionary.  But that's dead.  We can't go down that road again.
I don't agree.  The Negro middle class does exist, and it's rich material for a dramatic series or sitcom.
I'm telling you it's not.
He goes to his desk, picks up Delacroix's scripts and sta throwing them one by one against the window.

The middle class black family moves into a white suburban enclave.  The middle class black family moves into a small Southern town that is run by the KKK.  The middle class single black father raises his teenage daughter.  The middle class single black father raises his teenage daughter.  The middle class single black mother raises her teenage son.  And so on and so forth.  It's too clean, too antiseptic...
...to white?  I still feel all of my scripts would make good shows.
Delacroix, wake up, brother man. The reason why they didn't get picked up was because nobody - and I mean NOBODY - niggers and crackers alike wants to see that junk.
I've never been given a fair shot.
You got your head stuck up your ass with your Harvard education and your pretentious ways.  Brother man, I'm blacker than you.  I'm keepin' it real and you're frontin', trying to be white.

I'm an oreo, a sell out?  Because I don't aspire to do HOMEBOYS FROM OUT OF SPACE, SECRET DIARY OF DESMOND PFEIFFER, A PJ's or some as you might put it, some "nigger" show?  I'm a Tom?  I'm whiter than white and you're blacker than black? Is that what you think?

That's exactly what I think.  I want you to create something that people want to see.  Let's be honest, the majority of the people in the country are deaf, dumb and blind and I'm including 35 million African-Americans.  You know and I know "niggers" set the trend, set the styles.  This is a golden opportunity now.  These idiots have to be led to the water.
I'm not sure if I can deliver what you want.
You will or you'll be back at BET so quick you'll never know what hit you.  I need a mid-season replacement and pronto.  It will be on the fast track.

What is it you want from me?  Some plantation follies?  Some sitcom that takes place on a watermelon patch?  Some show that follows four nigger generations of junkies and crackheads?  You want me to go back to the ante bellum days?

Yes!  Yes!  Yes!  I want a show that will make headlines, that will have millions and millions of households tuned in, glued to their televisions every week.  I want advertisers dying to buy on this show.  I'm gonna squeeze this show out of you if it kills you.
WE SEE a street lamp, and coming out of it are some wires WE FOLLOW the wires into a tenement building. The residents have tapped into a street light courtesy of CON EDISON for power.

Cheeba stands in front of the makeshift kitchen, which includes a hot plate, and prepares a gourmet meal of a ta Spanish dish.  The clean apartment is furnished with stuf people have thrown out that they picked up on the street.
I'm starvin' like Marvin.
My world famous, famous world Arroz con pollo will be ready very soon.
Hurry up, I wanna watch HBO.
Did we get our bill yet?
They both laugh.
I guess that will come with the rent, gas, and Con Ed bills, too.
Ahh, the luxuries of life.
Yo, check it.  This is good and all that but one day soon I want to have much Benjamins so I can have a nice crib and pay all my bills. You hear me.
Chill, I'm the brains behind this outfit.
And I'm the feet.
Yo, you gotta show some patience. You want me to snap my fingers and presto chango - you're an overnight sensation.  Son, there is no such thing.
I'm tired of waiting.
He sits in front of a large flat-screen television, watch the Yankee game and eating his takeout Chinese food.  On of the monitor, he has attached a sign that reads "FEED T
She sits in front of her television, hand on remote, flip channels and eating takeout Chinese food.
They both are devouring the chicken with rice, as they wa bootleg HBO.
Delacroix sits at his desk, a ream of white bond paper in front of him, a box of number-two pencils and an electric pencil sharpener.
I was never good at performing under the gun.
Pencil after pencil gets inserted and sharpened to a knif like point.
Well, this wasn't a gun, it was a bazooka and it was pressed dead blank right against my dome.
Delacroix, staring at the blank ream of paper.  It is ver intimidating.
Monitor.  Bernie Williams is at the plate for the New Yor Yankees.
Sign atop monitor.  Again, it reads "FEED THE IDIOT BOX."
She too is blank.  A screen saver bobs and weaves on her laptop.
Delacroix grabs a pencil and put it to paper.
Paper.  He doodles.
Manray screws out the bare light bulb which is the sole source of illumination and lays down onto his mattress on the floor.
Sloan closes her laptop and jumps into her bed.
Delacroix is already in the bed, the lights are out.
Delacroix, who's wide awake.
Manray and Cheeba are both sound asleep.
Cheeba, he has a sheet pulled over his head.
Manray, who's sawing logs, snoring loudly.

head_text.subj: OFF-SCREEN, WE HEAR A RUCKUS, A BIG COMMOTION. VOICES

text: yelling.  Police sirens, cars and trucks.
Apartment.  Cheeba and Manray run to the window and look
The street is filled with police cars, vans and wagons. Helicopters hover overhead with their searchlights on the building.
Oh snap!  It's a raid!
Cheeba and Manray jump into their cloths.
Cops in riot gear storm into the tenement.  A police chie barks over a speaker system.
Please evacuate this building.  All of you are illegal residents of this condemned building.  Please leave immediately, by order of the Mayor of New York City, Rudolph Giuliani.
Stairwell.  It's bedlam.  The hundreds of SQUATTERS who h been living here all making a bad dash trying to flee the NYPD as they "bumrush the show."
Floor.  Cheeba and Manray try to push against the crowd.
Not this way.  Out through the fire escape.
The COPS are running up the staircase.  People try to esc with as many of their belongings that they can hold.
My tap shoes.
EUREKA!!
He jumps out of bed.
Oh my God!!!
She too jumps out of bed.

It is a MADHOUSE, BEDLAM.  It's PANDEMONIUM.  The Squatte are being seized as soon as they come out of the tenement Searchlights go back and forth, as the cops make their arrests and fill the "Paddy" wagons.
Street.  The Squatters are like ROACHES in a dark kitchen night, scrambling as the lights turn on.  Do you remember those old "RAID" commercials.  "Let's scram, IT'S RAID!!!
The phone rings.
Delacroix picks it up.  They yell in unison.
Manray!
Manray!
How did you know?
It hit me like a ton of bricks.
How can this be?  You and me at the same time, the exact same thought. It's scary.
The idea was out there in the universe.  Now what?
Cheeba and Manray run down the fire escape and just elude group of cops.
Fence.  They lay still as the Fuzz run past them.
We ran out without my shoes and the floor.  I gotta get my stuff.  What about our savings?
Are you crazy?  The joint is crawling with cops now.  You wanna go to Rikers?  Go to the hoosegow?
Manray looks at his friend, he knows he is right, at leas this time.
Delacroix and Sloan sip hot coffee as they stand in front their office building.
Manray was under our nose the whole time.
Do you know how you will use him?
Not yet, but this thing will never get made.
You lost me.
Dunwitty wants a Coon show.  And that's what I'm going to give him, it's going to be so racist, so negative, he won't have the balls to put it on the air.  Hence I'll prove my point.
What point is that?
The point being that him, the networks don't want Black people on television unless they are buffoons.
Sounds risky to me.
You getting cold feet?
I'm in till the end.
Good.  I'm going to need your support.
Can't you just quit?  Walk away?
And lose out on my money?  The only way I get paid is if I get fired. And that's what I intend to do.
It is pouring rain and Delacroix and Sloan huddle under a umbrella.
Everything was going according to plan.  I was working on the outline. Dunwitty was off my back for now.
Delacroix.
But there was a catch.  A big catch.
Sloan.
Manray and Cheeba were nowhere to be found.
Manray and Cheeba are soaking wet.  They stand together i doorway, trying to stay out of the elements.
Street.  They run in the downpour.
It was like they had disappeared off the face of the earth.
Cheeba.
I had no contact numbers, no address, no beeper.
Manray.
No nuthin', no clues...
It is a sunny and pleasant morning.  Again, Sloan and Delacroix hold vigil.
Maybe something happened to them. Maybe they're lying in an alley bleed to death.
Manray better not be bleeding to death.  I need him.  After we're done he can do whatever he wants to do, until then, he's ours.
You're beginning to sound like Dunwitty.
Manray and Cheeba stand across the street from their form residence.  All of the doors and windows have been boarde up and two cops stand watch.  They both look defeated, di and hungry.
Sloan gets off the elevator and sees a skirmish.  TWO SECURITY GUARDS are trying to escort Manray and Cheeba ou of the building.
His name is Delapoint.
WE have no one by that name.
Delapot.  Dela-something.
De La Soul ain't here either. Let's go.  Out.  Off the premises.
Manray turns around and sees Sloan.
Sloan!  She knows us.
The security guard stops.
It's alright.  They are associates of Mr. Delacroix.
Sorry, Ms. Hopkins.  They both walked in off the street without an appointment.
Do you need an escort?
That won't be needed.
He sits in front of his TV and watches a tape of the old "Amos 'n' Andy" show.  Sloan leads Manray and Cheeba in.
Eureka!  Where've you been?
He hugs them both.
Sloan and I have been looking all over for you.
You'd take no offense if we called you DeLa for short?
No offense.
Manray needs a job.
Delacroix smiles at Sloan.
We got evicted from our home. We've both been on the streets for the last week.
We was coming to see you.
If it's not too much trouble could you order us some food?
We're starving.
I apologize.  What would you like to eat?  Anything you want.
A feast of McDonald's is taking place.  Cheeba and Manray are stuffing Big Macs, Fish Deluxes and large french frie into their mouths.  They were famished.
I have this concept for a TV pilot. There's no guarantee it will get made but regardless, you'll still make some money.
How much?
First things first.  I have to know if Manray is up for this.
What do I have to do?
Some tap dancing, some singing.
Where do I sign?
What kind of show is this gonna be?
Different.
How different?
Trust me.  Of course I still have to pitch it to my boss, but we'll have an answer one way or the other.
DeLa, I'm aboard.  As long as I get to hoof and get paid too!!!
That's right.  Money turns the wheel.
What about in the mean time?  Not the in between time?
You'll both get an advance and you can stay with me.
Bet.
I would like to change your name.
To what?
You're now Mantan.
Mantan?  I don't even care as long as I'm dancing.  Which reminds me, I need some new kicks.
Manray holds two Capezio shopping bags of shoes as he wal next to Sloan.
I never had a really real pair before.
You've never had any formal training, either?
Not a class, not a thing, just picked stuff up by myself.
I wish I had your natural talent. God only makes that visit once in a while.
You sing and dance?
A little.  I just graduated from NYU film school.  Cinema studies.
So what's up with you and DeLa?
What do you mean?
Are you and him kicking it? Knocking boots. Y'knowwhatI'mtalkin'bout.
No, we're not knocking boots.  I got this internship while I still was at NYU, DeLa was impressed with my get up and go and hired me to be his assistant.
I'm sure that was the only thing he was impressed with.  You look beautiful like that.
If that was suppose to be a compliment, I thank you.
You're welcome.  You shouldn't give up on performing.
Why do you say that?  You've never seen me.
I think that would probably make you the happiest.  When I'm hoofing, I mean really doing my thing, hitting it, nothing compares to that feeling in the world.
I envy you.  That's the way I want to feel about my work.
Sloan walks from the subway to her block.
Street.  A huge black Chevy Suburban follows her, all the windows are tinted jet black, you cannot see it all into She notices the vehicle and starts to walk faster.
Corner.  As Sloan tries to cross at the corner, the Subur pulls up in front of her, blocking her path.
Suburban.  A tall black man jumps out of the Chevy.  This BIG BLACK.
Li'l Sister.
Corner.
You idiot.  You almost gave me a massive coronary.
I didn't mean to scare you like that.
Well you did.
Give me some?
I'm not huggin' you in the middle of the street.  You must be crazy, Julius.
Whoa, hold up li'l sis'.  I done told you 'bout that.  Julius ain't my name, you better recognize Hopkins was our slave name.  My true name is...
I'm not callin you Big Black Africa. Mommy and Daddy named you Julius.
BIG BLACK is the first name and AFRICA is the last.
He hugs her, she becomes lost in his huge arms and laughs
Big Black is rummaging through his sister's refrigerator.
Damn, Sis, you don't keep no food up in here in dis' piece.
I order out mostly.  So what do I owe this visit to?
My group we need some exposure. Was wondering if you could hook a brother up?
Hook you up?  The Mau-Mau's?  You must be smoking.  Why in the world would I want to hook up a bunch of red, black and green flag-waving pseudo revolutionairies?
So now I see where you're coming from.  Just because we ain't rapping about Gucci, Timberland, Rolex, Benz, Cristal, ho's and bitches, we're pseudo.
Who are you revolting against?

We're revolting against the powers that be, that been enslaving the minds and hearts of all people of color.  And we won't stop rapping till we bring about the overthrow of the government of the U.S. of A.
Please.
If you were really down you would get us together with that boss of yours.  What's his name again?
Delacroix.
Yeah, him.
What makes you think he would write a show about the Mau-Mau's.
C'mon, why not?  The Monkees had a show.  Look at all that other junk that's on TV.  We got underground cult following.
You don't have the demographics.
So are you telling me that you wouldn't even introduce me to Delacroix or set up a meeting?  I'm talking 'bout me, your only brother, ya own flesh and blood, hook a brother up, youknowwhatI'msayin'.
That'swhatI'msayin'.  I'm not blowin' my young career, brother or no brother, for you or anybody else.
There is a name, a term for your kind, the likes of you.  Back in slavery days, you would be classified as a house nigga.
If you think I'm a house nigga then that's your prerogative.  You got your ways to affect change, I have mine.  And I would appreciate it very much if you took ya field nigga ass out of my house.
My own sister throwin' me out.  I hope to seeya later when you get ya mind right.  Don't bother letting me out.
That's mighty black of you.
Big Black slams the door.
One by one, the team enters the office and sits down on t sofa.
Delacroix, I'm glad you got your mind right.
It's right and tight.  Good morning, let me introduce you to everybody. You know my assistant, Sloan.
Hello.
This is Cheeba.
Nice to meet you.
And this is Manray.
How do you do?
Good.  I like the names.  Very theatrical.
We're all happy to be here and I'm going to paint a picture for you.
I'm wid it.

I've done a lot of soul searching and once again you are right.  In my previous work it's been all surface, superficial.  I have never really dug deep.  Not anymore.  As Mark Twain fully understood satire is the way.  Race has always been a hot button in this country's history and it needs to be pushed harder.  If we are ever to live side by side in peace and harmony. It's about promoting racial healing.
Go on.  Good so far.

I know you're familiar with minstrel shows.  They came about at the turn of the 19th century.  It was a variety show in which the talent was in blackface - singing, dancing, telling jokes, doing skits. Dunwitty, I ask you when was the last time there was a good variety show on the air.  Carol Burnett? HeeHaw?
Word!!!
So let's take this great form, this very American tradition of entertainment into the 21st century, into the new millennium.
The name of the show?
It is called: MANTAN - THE NEW MILLENNIUM MINSTREL SHOW.
I'm lovin' it.  You know how I know? Because I'm getting a boner, my Johnson is hard, no disrespect my sister.
Dunwitty starts walking around his office, pumping his fi
I'm feelin' dis'!
It will take a lot of courage and backbone on the part of the CNS to get this on the air.  In fact, I would understand fully if the subject matter is deemed too risque, too controversial.
Don't worry about that, that's my department.  Now who do we cast? We need a star.  Can Whoopi sing or dance?
I don't know if Whoopi is the way to go.
Are these our two stars, sitting here in front of my nose?  Which one is Mantan again?
That's me.
And Cheeba is Sleep 'n' Eat.
Cheeba.  A look of surprise is on his face.  Complete, ut surprise.
That's a great handle.
Mantan and Sleep 'n Eat.  Two real coons.  I know we're way out there but it's satire.
I want you take it there.  All the way to the edge and back.
Sloan looks at Delacroix with concern.
Every week we follow the trials and tribulations of two real coons - Mantan and Sleep 'n Eat.  The Dusky Duo.
What are there character traits?
Ignorant, dullwitted, lazy, and unlucky.
Exactly!
Mantan is an uneducated Negro who always by some stroke of unbelievable stupidity makes his best laid plans go haywire.
And Sleep 'n Eat is his comical sidekick?
Yep, you guessed it.
This could be bigger than "Amos and Andy."
Protest finally forced "Amos and Andy" off the air.  Could stop us from ever getting on.
Let'em try.  I will kill to make this happen.
Delacroix looks at Sloan.
Negroes would be in an uproar.
So what.  We would just give the NAACP a donation that would be the end of that.  No such thing as bad publicity.  So what.  Earlier you said singing and dancing.
Mantan right here is a gifted hoofer.  He has educated feet.
Who are the other characters?
Do we have characters?  How about Honeycutt, Snowflake, Rastus, Nigger, Jim, Sambo, Jungle Bunny, and how could we forget Aunt Jemima.
Dunwitty is dying with laughter.  He's the only one.
We gonna hit 'em wid da BOMB DICKEY on dis' one.  What's the setting?
In the projects.  Like Eddie Murphy's "The PJ's."

Ya first bad move.  Projects been done.  That's one of the problems now, everything, movies, TV, are set in the urban jungle, da hood. That's so tired.  Mantan's Millennium Minstrel Show should be set on a plantation.  In Alabama.
And every week these Alabama porch monkeys will make us cry, make us laugh, make us look at our own humanity.  Make us feel good to be alive.
I don't know about that plantation angle.
What are you talkin' 'bout?  It's the move.  Stay wid me now.  We're movin' fast.  What does everybody else think about this?
We'd get a lot of mail.
She laughs, it's a fake one at that.
Mr. Dunwitty, there wouldn't be another show like it.
I've always wanted to be on television.
I like you.  Sleep 'n Eat.  That's funny.  Mantan, how do you feel about performing in black face?
As long as the hoofing is real, that I can do my thing, I can blacken up.  Let me hit it, beats and rhythms, express myself.
Show me a little somethin' somethin'.
Mantan starts to put on his new tap shoes.
Delacroix, you dug deep, deeper than deep.
Mantan is ready.
